As Lilly was being carried by Terry, Alicia skipping happily and twirling her frilly princess dress around to show off her latest princess diaper (this one was better because it had Cinderella on it), Lilly looked over at her friend. "Are there any donuts left?"

Alicia stopped and gasped, "Yeah! I'd almost forgotted! Dey's dis way!" She grabbed Terry's elbow and started dragging them down the hall, Lilly giggling as she bounced in Terry's arms. And Terry meanwhile was trying not to drop his sorta-not really-girlfriend while being dragged along by her friend.

"Donuts!" Lilly cheered as they approached the breakroom, squirming her way out of Terry's arms and toddling inside quickly with Alicia.

As Terry's stood outside the room for a good bit, he heard laughing and playing and yelling, all in regards to toys or snacks as far as he could tell. After a bit, when the chaos sounded like it'd died down, he cautiously peaked inside, and was astonished a time the mess. All across the room, food was strewn about like a massive food fight had occurred, a smashed PB&J was stuck to the wall, what looked like spaghetti dangled from the fans on the ceiling, not to mention the mess that coated the floor. And the various 'employees' were covered in various foodstuffs, over in the corner, there was Lilly, Alicia, a blonde girl, and a guy smiling at the three very messy women who he assumed would be Dan.

"Hi Terry!" Lilly waved, her hands, dress, and face covered in jelly, Alicia, Dan and the blonde all in similar states of jelly-donut mess. "Dey was jelly donuts!" Lilly said happily, hugging him clumsily.

"Lilly," Terry said carefully, trying not to get anymore jelly on his suit than she just did, "you're all messy, please don't get me messy too."

Lilly looked down at her messy dress, "Oh, ok." And took it right off, exposing her breasts to him without a care in the world. "Is dat better?" She asked, the jelly stains on her hands and mouth only making her cuter with her pigtails.

"Yeah!" Alicia asked form the floor, her princess dress messily folded up next to her, her larger breasts also on display, "Now dat we's nakie, we's cwean!"

"Yeah, no." Terry said, ignoring Dan and the blonde as they continued to get messy eating the remaining few donuts, "Lets take you girls to the bathroom and all cleaned up."

"We have a baff in da baffroom?" Alicia asked as she followed Terry.

"I'm not sure..." Terry admitted, "But I know you have sinks and wipes, so I can get you two, and hopefully y jacket, cleaned up."

A few minutes back inside the bathroom wiping down, cleaning and gently ensuring his jacket was thoroughly cleaned; Terry took ample amounts of time in order to clean the food stains and marks on Lilly and Alicia's bodies. The sight of a man cleaning two almost-naked women in a public office bathroom was oddly normal. As strange as it felt for Terry -- as strange as it could be, seeing the normality for Lilly and Alicia, he wasn't as embarassed or as shocked as he thought he was going to be.

Lilly and Alicia shared a changing table. Both of which obediently complied with Terry's various commands and instructions, while Alicia remained somewhat impatient and fussy -- Lilly, on the other hand; kept listening to her new 'boyfriend' and happily complied with his instructions.

Soon after being cleaned; Lilly and Alicia took the charge and lead Terry outside the office and into the main street. The main street was a collection of stores, resturants and playplaces which accomodated people of all ages, shapes and sizes. A large portion of shoppers and people walking through the streets -- upon Terry's own analysis, happened to behave and dress simiarly to Lilly, Alicia and the rest of the infantilised townspeople Terry had seen so far.

Many storefronts were coloured in specific brightly coloured signs, each providing simple signs with basic images instead of letters or numbers. Overwhelmed by the sudden choices; Terry turned to Lilly and Alicia who were busy aimlessly toddling up and down the street, each with their interests going in different directions.

"Where should we go?" Terry asked, he scanned the various stores and didn't know where to begin. The gnawing feeling in the back of head told him something was wrong; but he couldn't explain what it was. "I don't even know where to begin."

Lilly and Alicia turned back to Terry -- each sporting a smile with a half-baked plan in mind, they looked at a nearby store and toddled back over to Terry.

The choice of seating happened to be a small corner table. Hidden, enclosed and partially blocked from view, the rest of the patrons and servers weren't able to mostly see the table. It was probably the best possible seating arrangement made for Terry and his new friends. Terry and Lilly were closely sat together as Lilly playfully scooted closer and closer to Terry's nervous body; soon latching onto his arm with her own and resting her head on his shoulder.

Alicia occupied herself with a set of crayons and colouring books. Her colouring motions were inconsistent, sometimes drifting off the page and onto the table itself which already had several marks of crayon from previous drawers. She crossed her legs, preferring to lean against the table in her seat -- impatiently fidgeting as she mumbled and cooed at her own handiwork.

"Aren't you feeling cold or anything?" Terry looked under his arm; seeing as Lilly latched onto his and snuggled herself up against his warm chest. "Also, isn't there a menu? Aren't we going to ask the servers?"

"Nuh-uh," Lilly hummed, smiling. "It's good here. The pretty servers will come and they'll give us lot'sa num nums."

"I'd like a sandwich. I'll pay." Terry responded, his nervous demeanor eventually cooled as his arm eventually trailed against Lilly's bare back and gently pulled her closer. "It's the least I can do seeing as I'm only in town for a short while anyway."

A server slowly approached the table; similar to the rest, donning nothing but a thick diaper and a small waist apron, eventually sharing a smile for Lilly, Alicia and a look of puzzlement for Terry and his strange clothing. The server smiled regardless, "Hello all! Who wants some num nums?"

"I do! I do!" Alicia raised her hand, "Me first! Me first! I was waiting the longest!"

"Now, now," The server tsked, "What about your friend, first?"

While Alicia huffed and moaned in disagreement, Terry felt himself slowly slipping into his seat as his nervousness came back as he glanced at the woman's large breasts for a micro-second. "I'm fine. I'd l-like to order a sandwich, please."

"Aww," The server chuckled, "This must be your first time! We don't do food here, all the big babies come here for some breast milk. It's all we've got!"

"That's alright," Terry looked away, "I'll pass and wait for these two to finish before we go elsewhere then."

"What's the matter, hun?" The server cooed, "Never had breastmilk before? I'll give a sample for free if ya' like." She slowly approached closer to Terry and grabbed him by the hand. He was quickly lifted onto his feed and his head driven closer to the woman's breasts, but with enough strength, Terry removed himself from the woman's grasp and backed away.

"I'm fine, seriously." Terry shivered, "I don't mean to be rude, offensive, or whatever, but that stuff doesn't interest me. I'd happily like a sandwich elsewhere. This is getting a little too uncomfortable for my tastes."

As Terry quickly left, Lilly sat somewhat puzzled and shocked at what she witnessed. She felt bad for her suggestion to eat out scaring Terry like this; but her tummy argued otherwise and the server was about to offer a feeding to her and Alicia. She looked at the nearby window and noticed Terry standing by the doorway, looking obviously shaken.

Her chest swelled as her boyfriend looked visibly upset, and judging from his expression, too shocked for words at the servers lack of permission.

"What a cranky butt!" The server huffed, "I've never fed an out-of-towner before. Didn't know they were so cranky about feedings like that."

"Special?" Alicia asked, her smile widened, "Like a surprise?"

"Yeah!" Lilly nodded, "It's a super 'welcome to town' surprise for Terry!"

It had been a few minutes since Terry finished his lunch; now occupying a nearby bench on the main street -- still looking as nervous as can be, idly glanced at the passersby and their infantile habits. A passing Mother appearing to be wearing a bright yellow sun dress, pushing a stroller which seated two children between the ages of four to thirteen. The sight of seeing children that old still donning diapers and acting alongside the adults should've been worrying to see -- but something took his mind off that.

He finally noticed Lilly and Alicia returning; each holding a shopping bag full of items, Terry felt more nervous than before but smiled at his new friends approach.

"H-Hey, Lilly. Alicia," Terry greeted the two, "What's in the bags?"

"Lot'sa stuff!" Alicia happily replied, "Lilly's got a special present for you! And so do I!"

"R-Really?" Terry blinked, "What is it?"

Terry's eyes almost bugged out of his head as Lilly leaned in and planted an awkward and somewhat sloppy kiss on his cheek, as she pulled back with a satisfied smile on her face, Terry sat there, faintly rubbing the spot with his fingers.

"Why'd you kiss me?" He asked, looking at her with an unknown expression.

Lilly looked down, "I should'a checked on you after the lady almost gave you num nums without you wantin' them." She looked back up at him, "You's my boyfriend! Imma supposed to help you!"

Terry rubbed the back of his head uncomfortably, "Yeah, its kinda my fault too, I should've realized where we were and not stormed out of there. I almost ruined lunch." He eyed the bags warily, "What's in the bags?"

"Diapees!" Alicia squealed, taking out the blandest boys diaper they had, simple white with blue highlights.

"And some shirts and a binky." Lilly added, handing over the bag she as holding, "After your lunch, we gotta get you in a diaper quick before you makes a mess."

Terry laughed awkwardly, "I appreciate it girls, but I don't need diapers, I'll just use a toilet."

Lilly and Alicia looked a tad him oddly, "What's a toy-let?" Lilly asked.

"Can we's pway wit it?" Alicia asked, it sounded like a toy! Even had toy in the name!

"Uh, no." Terry said, feeling awkward again, but powering through it, "Its like a chair, but with water, and you go to use it instead of diapers." The two girls stared at him like he was describing theoretical physics. "It's white like a bathtub?" He supplied.

"Nope, never seen one." Lilly said, thinking about it, she was pretty sure she'd notice that thing. Sounded impractical too, having to go somewhere to poopy or pee instead of just going. As Alicia started to suck on her fingers and let the two have their deidussion, Lilly remembered something! "Wait!" She grabbed Terry and Alicia's hands, leading them to the parking lot of the office building, "We'll take my car to the library! They have a book on everything there!"

Terry was intrigued, she had a car? And did Lilly realize she'd used her diaper?

If only he knew what kind of car, at least it'd fit all three of them and the shopping bags.

The journey back to the parking lot was short. A sudden wetting by Lilly filled her diaper close its leaking point -- leaving her to further emphasise her toddler-esque waddle, prompting Terry to prepare himself for the act of changing another of Lilly's diapers. He was presented with Lilly's car, but the sight of the adult-sized tyke car, wasn't what made him start to question everything about it. He was wondering about the possible space to change Lilly.

"The trunk is a place where we can change!" Lilly unlocked the backdoor; revealing the trunk and a flat surface which somewhat resembled a changing table. A small collection of changing supplies were onboard the vehicle.

As Lilly was gently laid down, Terry began to question the town of Redwood and its infantile society. The town appeared to have been like this for some time -- the amount of time being completely unknown. The library was an excellent start if he wanted to learn more about the town and its inhabitant's lifestyle.

"I was wondering," Terry began, he slowly removed the tapes from Lilly's soggy diaper, "In the library, there's books about the town, correct?"

"I dunno," Lilly responded, her eyes remained on Terry as her smile grew bigger. "The library is lot'sa fun, though. Lot'sa colouring books for everyone!"

"I wasn't thinking about colouring books, Lilly." Terry tsked, a newer fresh diaper was slid underneath Lilly's frame and soon the tapes were pulled across. "I wanted to learn about Redwood and why things are the way they are."

"Oh," Lilly simply answered, she wiggled her legs as the tapes were fastened, leaning upright to give Terry a cuddle before hopping off her changing seat. "Babies don't need'ta think about stuff like that, but if you wanna go to the library then we can have fun there!"

"Thanks, Lilly." Terry smiled.

"Why we gotta go to the library?" Alicia whined childishly, "Library doesn't have any toys I like."

"There's pretty princess books there," Lilly responded, "Lot'sa pretty pink stuff, too."

The suggestion from Lilly seemed to immediately turn Alicia over to her side; with Alicia quickly throwing her shopping bags into the trunk as she climbed into her passenger seat. Terry took the front passenger seat and adjusted his belt, while his seat moreso resembled a toddler's safety seat -- he couldn't stop thinking about the possible answers at the library.

A slightly awkward 'drive' to the library in the tyke car, and Terry, Lilly, and Alicia were all at the door of the public library. "Here we are!" Lilly said excitedly, grabbing her diaper bag, leaving Alicia's in the back seat, they would only need the one. "We gonna get da diaper on you now?" She asked, holding up the bland boys diaper.

Terry shook his head, "No.". He looked up at the professional looking building, it's serious nature somewhat diminished by the childish drawings of houses and trucks on the steps, in what appeared to be sidewalk chalk. "I'm sure they have a toilet in there."

"I wanna pway wit' da toy-let!" Alicia whined from behind them, sucking her thumb, jealous that Terry would get to play with a new toy first. Not that she knew what a toilet was of course...

"It's Terry's toy, so we gotta let him use it first." Lilly said somewhat seriously, also curious as to what a 'toy-let' was, and what did a 'real let' look like then?

Shaking his head as the two argued over who got to play with the toilet, he'd probably have to demonstrate, he realized, the three opened the doors. Looking around, he saw the inside was decorated like a daycare, childish scribblings on much of the walls, and thankfully, the bookshelves all looked normal. "Shouldn't be too hard." Terry said, looking for the newspaper archive section, "Just got to look back far enough."

Eventually, he found it, and oddly, the most recent paper in the archive was dated last week, but showed Lilly and Alicia being celebrated for saving the firm they'd worked at from economic disaster, and a mention of a comet passing by and a public celebration would be held in the park. The next previous one had the town celebrating their founders day, with 'authentic' frontier food, and a love shooting competition.

"It's almost like this happened over night." He said to himself, looking at Lilly and Alicia's picture in the paper, and then back at the two nearly naked, incontinent women as they play patty cake. "Lilly, Alicia, come here please." He called.

"You's finded da toy-let?" Alicia asked hopefully, Lilly looking curiously at the paper.

"No." Terry sighed, "Do you girls remember taking this picture last week?" He asked, pointing at the picture of them, dressed in smart business suits, not the frilly princess outfits they'd worn earlier.

"Nu-uh!" Alicia shook her head, back to sucking on her thumb and her attention spans lost.

Lilly though looked at the picture, it seemed so familiar, but why was she dressed all boring like that? No frills? No pretty dress? Her hair not up in pigtails with pretty bows? And from the waist, apparently no diaper! "Uh.....no?" She said, not too sure where the picture was from, or why she was dressed so oddly.

This wasn't making any sense. Far more so for Lilly, less so for Alicia's patience -- the image of her and Alicia was completely different, the clothes, makeup and the lack of diapers was the strangest thing so far. She couldn't remember such an event taking place, at all. Her look of concentration eventually broke into a look of worry and confusion as the image began sticking in her mind, as if somewhat wasn't quite right, but she couldn't find the words to figure out why.

"This doesn't make any sense," Terry began, he inspected the photograph once more, "You're wearing the type of suits that I'd normally wear. No diapers, nakedness or anything. It's like you're both completely different people now. How unusual."

"What does it mean, Terry?" Lilly asked, she continued to think it over, "I dun' know what it means."

"I know this place is different than other towns, but," Terry abruptly paused, his eyes widened slightly, "What if, and I'll try and make it easy for you -- the town isn't supposed to be like this. I always thought something wasn't right about this place, but looking at the archives, it's like the town changed into a giant daycare within a short timespan. For some reason; I couldn't shake this feeling that something was wrong, but I kept thinking everything was okay. We need to work together and figure what's going on."

The words coming from Terry seemed to resonate with Lilly, slightly. She nodded; only for her cheeks to redden as the idea of her 'boyfriend' acting like a detective made her feel warm and fuzzy inside. The feelings of confusion still lingered, but Terry's insistance on assisting her and looking after her made things more worthwhile.

"What do we do now, Terry?" Lilly asked, she felt nervous, her eyes lingered on the photograph of her wearing the strange suit similar to Terry's, "Is something bad gonna happen?"

"I don't know. I think it's best if we work together and solve this mystery." Terry replied with a smile, he took Lilly by the hand and pulled her in closer, tightening his grip on her with a sense of reassurance. "Let's try and look elsewhere for more clues. Perhaps more books, archives and information about the town might be a good start."

She couldn't understand what Terry was trying to say, but she knew that this sounded important; and how it linked directly to the strange photograph in the newspaper of herself and Alicia wearing the business suits.
